wikipedia_page.main: David Myerscough-Jones FCSD (15 September 1934 – 21 April 2010) was an English film, television, and theatre production designer. He spent the majority of his career with BBC TV, as well as in the theatre and opera production companies. He worked with the British composer Benjamin Britten on Peter Grimes (1969 Snape Maltings, Aldeburgh), Owen Wingrave (1970 BBC TV World Premier, Snape Maltings), and Die Winteriesse (1970 Britten Piano, Peter Pears Tenor).
